arm_group.description: this first day, the patient will be evaluated with polar and blood pressure monitor. These data will be the basal one.

One week later the screening, the patient underwent to the surgery to remove his lower third molar. In this day, will be analyzed 4 points: basal, after the anesthesia, after the avulsion and 20 minutes after the surgery.
One week later the surgery, the patients will be evaluated again.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to use heart rate variability as a monitor of cardiovascular
      safety during third molar surgeries, using the Polar heart rate-meter.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Heart Rate Variability in Third Lower Molars Surgeries

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy Patients (ASA I)

          -  Need to remove one of Lower Third Molar.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  smoking

          -  pregnant

study_pop.textblock: 30 patients from the community sample in Dentistry School - University of Sao Paulo

intervention.intervention_name: Use the Polar Cardiac rate meter

facility.name: Faculdade de Odontologia da Universidade de são Paulo

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Heart Rate Variability in Third Lower Molars Surgeries

oversight_info.authority: Brazil: Associação Fundo de Incentivo à Pesquisa

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of cardiac safety during third molar surgeries

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: study of heart rate variability during third molars surgeries with the Polar Cardiac Rate-meter.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
